author: pdobacz
content: There has also been feedback from Vyper team to relax RETURNDATALOAD to pad with zeros instead. However RETURNDATACOPY, as it is now, throws on out-of-bounds read. This means we either have these two inconsistent in EOF, or we need to update RETURNDATACOPY's behavior in EOF, or introduce RETURNDATACOPY2 with the zero padding behavior, banning RETURNDATACOPY in EOF.

author: gumb00
content: One of the reasons is "appending the data section" operation happening when deploying new contract. If data section header were optional, this operation could involve inserting the header when there's no data before the operation, and that is costly. When it's mandatory we only update the size in the header.
